meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To provide for the extension of certain leases of land in the New Territories.

preamble.name: preamble
preamble.heading: Preamble
preamble.recital: WHEREAS the Joint Declaration of the Government of the United Kingdom and the Government of the People’s Republic of China on the Question of Hong Kong signed in Beijing on 19 December 1984 provides that certain leases of land expiring before 30 June 1997 may be extended until not later than 30 June 2047:

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the New Territories Leases (Extension) Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application
section.leadIn: This Ordinance applies to every New Territories lease that exists at the commencement* of this section and that, but for this Ordinance, would expire before 30 June 1997, not being—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a lease for special purposes; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a lease in respect of which the lessee registers a memorandum under section 5.

subsection.def: *appointed day (指定日期) means the day appointed (words omitted as spent—E.R. 6 of 2021) for section 6 to come into operation;

Land Registry register (土地註冊處註冊紀錄冊) means the register that is kept in the Land Registry, under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128), in respect of land that is the subject of a New Territories lease; (Amended 8 of 1993 s. 2)

def.name: LeaseForSpecialPurposes
def.leadIn: lease for special purposes (特殊用途契約) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a lease that satisfies the description in subsection (2) but is not—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a lease of any of the lots specified in Part II of the Schedule; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a lease granted to the Hong Kong Housing Authority, the MTR Corporation Limited, the Kowloon-Canton Railway Corporation or the Hong Kong Housing Society; (Amended 13 of 2000 s. 65)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a lease of any of the lots specified in Part I of the Schedule;

subsection.def: New Territories lease (新界契約) and lease (契約) mean a lease of land in the New Territories that is a Government lease and include an agreement to grant such a lease; (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 71)

short term tenancy (短期租約) means a lease expressed to be granted for a term of not more than 7 years; and in calculating that period for the purpose of this definition there shall be excluded any extension or renewal of the lease that has occurred, or may occur, by virtue of the exercise of any right.

subsection.leadIn: The lease description referred to in the definition of lease for special purposes in subsection (1) is that the lease—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contains a prohibition, expressed or intended by the parties to enure for the full term of the lease, against the assignment of the land that is the subject of the lease or of any interest therein; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contains no provision whereby the land that is the subject of the lease, and every interest therein, could be assigned by the lessee upon the occurrence of any event or contingency, or upon compliance with any condition,

subsection.continued: whether or not the express provisions of the lease permit the land that is the subject of the lease, or any interest therein, to be assigned with the consent of the lessor or any Government authority, or to be charged, mortgaged or sublet.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Note to be made in Land Office register of all special purpose leases

subsection.content: Where a lease is a lease for special purposes, the Land Officer shall make a note to that effect in the Land Office register before the appointed day.

subsection.leadIn: A lease shall for the purposes of this Ordinance be conclusively deemed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be a lease for special purposes if, before the appointed day, a note has been made by the Land Officer in the Land Office register to the effect that it is such a lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not to be a lease for special purposes if no such note has been made by the Land Officer in the Land Office register by the appointed day.

subsection.content: A lessee may exclude from the application of this Ordinance his interest under a lease, other than an undivided share in the land to which the lease relates, by registering in the Land Office register, before the appointed day, a memorandum in a form specified by the Land Officer.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a person whose name is registered in the Land Office as owner, leaseholder or holder; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where more than one person is so registered in respect of the same interest or, in addition to any person so registered, any other person has an interest under—
paragraph.continued: registered in the Land Office, means all of them acting jointly.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Extension of leases
section.content: The term of a lease to which this Ordinance applies is extended, from the date on which it would, apart from this Ordinance, expire, until the expiry of 30 June 2047, without payment of any additional premium.

subsection.leadIn: During the period of the extension of a lease under section 6, the lease and any interest therein created by or under an instrument registered in the Land Registry shall, unless the contrary intention appears from the instrument, be subject to— (Amended 8 of 1993 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the same encumbrances and interests as applied immediately before the period of extension, including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any mortgage or charge, whether legal or equitable;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any mutual covenants, rights, easements, tenancies or other burdens of whatsoever kind or nature;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the same covenants, exceptions, reservations, stipulations, provisos and declarations (including the right of re-entry) as applied immediately before the period of extension, except the reservation of and covenant to pay rent;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), the Government rent payable under the Government Rent (Assessment and Collection) Ordinance (Cap. 515);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an exemption from liability to pay Government rent under the Government Rent (Assessment and Collection) Ordinance (Cap. 515), the annual rent payable immediately before the period of extension; and (Replaced 53 of 1997 s. 56)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a convenant by the lessee to pay the Government rent specified in paragraph (c)(i) or the annual rent specified in paragraph (c)(ii), as the case may be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of such Government rent, in accordance with the Government Rent (Assessment and Collection) Ordinance (Cap. 515);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of such annual rent, in the same manner and on the same days as applied immediately before the period of extension. (Replaced 53 of 1997 s. 56)

subsection.content: The rights and obligations of any person under any encumbrance, interest, covenant, exception, reservation, stipulation, proviso or declaration mentioned in paragraphs (a), (b), (c) and (d) of subsection (1) shall, unless the contrary intention appears from the instrument creating that encumbrance, interest, covenant, exception, reservation, stipulation, proviso or declaration, continue during the period of the extension of a lease under section 6 as if that period of extension were expressly mentioned in the instrument.

subsection.leadIn: Where the provisions of a lease whose term has been extended by section 6—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: empower the lessor, subject to the payment of compensation to the lessee, to resume the land that is the subject of the lease; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: prescribe a method of calculating the compensation that includes references to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a fraction, whose numerator is the figure one, of any sum; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the portion of the term that is unexpired at the date of resumption,

subsection.continued: the method of calculation shall be applied as if the denominator in the fraction were greater by 50 than that specified in the lease and as if the lease had originally been expressed to be granted for a term that included the period for which the lease is extended by section 6.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Breaches of covenants
section.content: Nothing in this Ordinance shall constitute a waiver of any right arising out of a breach of a covenant committed before the appointed day.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Power to make regulations
section.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may by regulation— (Amended 40 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: provide for entries to be made in the Land Registry register; (Amended 8 of 1993 s. 2)

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: generally, provide for the better carrying out of the provisions and purposes of this Ordinance.

part.name: PI
part.heading: Lots Specifically Included in the Definition of Lease for Special Purposes

paragraph.content: New Kowloon Permanent Pier No. 22 and Extension
Lot No. 1405 Section A in Demarcation District 6
Lot No. 1405 Section B in Demarcation District 6
Lot No. 1405 Remaining Portion in Demarcation District 6
Lot No. 3329 Remaining Portion in Demarcation District 102

part.name: PII
part.heading: Lots Specifically Excluded from the Definition of Lease for Special Purposes
